newsitem.title: USA: CBOT corn ends mixed, new lows set in most months.
newsitem.headline: CBOT corn ends mixed, new lows set in most months.

text.p: CBOT corn futures closed mixed with nearby months lower on a slide in wheat futures and new contract lows were set in nearly all but the nearby December, traders said.
"Wheat just pulled everything down today. We tried to rally but with the weakness in wheat we couldn't go anywhere," said Vic Lespinasse of Dean Witter Reynolds.
The new low for March is $2.62-1/4 a bushel, down from the previous low of $2.62-3/4 set on November 5.
Pressure also came from nearly ideal crop weather in South America, they said.
Lespinasse and others said the market Monday was hit by reports of excellent crop prospects in South America and spillover selling was in the market Tuesday.
The market especially took note of Argentine corn prospects.
"The South American crop is coming along well, especially Argentine corn," a trader said.
Corn futures were underpinned by slow farmer selling and steady to firm cash basis markets.
Corn closed 2-3/4 cents per bushel lower to one cent higher, with December down 1-1/2 at $2.65 a bushel.
Commercial buying underpinned the market with Cargill Inc, ADM Investor Services and Term Commodities each buying three million bushels of March, traders said.
But commercial bear spreading weighed on the nearbys and propped the back months.
Cargill Inc did two million March/December, ADM did 1.5 million March/December and Term Commodities did one million March/December, the traders said.
Corn futures volume was estimated at 65,000, below the 74,846 traded Monday, according to the CBOT.
In corn options, Refco Inc sold 400 March $2.70 calls at 6-1/2 cents and Farmers Commodities Corp bought 400 March $3.00 calls at 1-1/4 cents, traders said.
Corn options volume was estimated at 18,000, above the 17,160 traded Monday.
